results.title: A Look inside
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Shows different aspects of work inside the Australian National Animal Health Laboratory. After a brief introduction to the importance of the livestock industry and the effects of disease, viewers are taken inside the laboratory to see some of the microbiological features.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: What's for lunch?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Rob McCubbin, Trevor Lunn and Channel 7 for Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Panel discussion about nutrition in schools including scenes from actual classrooms, where panelists Phillip Hughes and Anne Keogh discuss a good food “Pyramid” with children at a Victorian primary school.

results.title: Keeping animals in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education for Zoo Education Service
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Karen Svalesen from the Zoo Education Service who examines the problems that can be encountered when keeping animals in the classroom. Suggests suitable animals and information sources to assist with animal care.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education for Zoo Education Service

results.title: That's entertainment. Part 2
results.creator_credit: David Melnick, Saul Chaplin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly cohost a stunning gallery of classic moments in MGM history. Features memorable performances by John Barrimore, Clark Gable, Greta Garbo and many others including the Marx Brothers, Abbot and Costello, Laurel and Hardy and the inimitable W C Fields. This video includes over ninety legendary superstars.

results.title: Curriculum Victoria: growing and learning
results.creator_credit: Warren Thomas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A talk by Michael Norman, which highlights the changing expectations our society has for adolescents. With reference to students of 1912, 1948 and 1979, who appear in the program, mention is made of the narrowing academic learning that occurred rather than a broadening of the curriculum.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warren Thomas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: That's dancing!
results.creator_credit: Jack Haley, David Niven Jr and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A collection of fifty famous dancers from the world of film, ballet and Broadway are presented in musical sequences ranging from the romantic ballroom dances of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers to the electrifying streetgate ballet of “West Side Story”. Highlights the classical brillance of Mikhail Baryshnikov and performances by Busby Berkeley and Michael Jackson.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: Apples and pears: the Australian story
results.brief_description: Focuses on the story of apple and pear production in Australia from fruitgrower to exporter, and is supplemented by a comprehensive teachers guide which provides an interesting approach to effective use of the video material - planning an advertising campaign.
results.description: Focuses on the story of apple and pear production in Australia from fruitgrower to exporter, and is supplemented by a comprehensive teachers guide which provides an interesting approach to effective use of the video material - planning an advertising campaign.

results.title: Fast talking
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Ross Matthews, AFI [au] and Old Data
results.brief_description: An Australian feature film that presents the story of fifteen year old Steve Carson, a con artist, spirited rebel and determined survivor in the face of crumbling family relationships. The many influences in his life are highlighted in a comedy of fast dialogue and outrageous escapades. Starring Rod Zuanic, Toni Allaylis, Chris Truswell, Gail Sweeny and Steve Bisley.

results.title: The Chosen
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Edie Landau, Ely Landau and Chosen Film Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Chaim Potok which explores the friendship that develops between two adolescent Jewish boys living in New York in the 1940s. The boys are from vastly different Jewish backgrounds, one being an Hasidic Jew and the other a Zionist. Features Rod Steiger, Maximilian Schell as the boys fathers together with Robby Benson and Barry Miller.
